title: 1D motion - time of free fall on moon

content.question: On a distant planet where the acceleration due to gravity is <math alttext="g sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math>, an object takes a time <math alttext="t sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math> to reach the ground when dropped from a height <math alttext="h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. On a small moon of the planet, the acceleration due to gravity is <math alttext="the fraction g sub P, over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mn>16</mn></mfrac></math>. How long does it take an object to reach the ground when it is dropped from the same height on the moon?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction t sub P, over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mn>16</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction t sub P, over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="4 times t sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="16 times t sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 times t sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
